deck:
Segura inc. is a Chicago-based design firm founded by Carlos Segura in 1991. He created it with the goal of blending as much "fine art" into "commercial art" as he could.
It develops various forms of design, including the covers for Vertigo's The Filth comic series.
name: Segura Inc. (Carlos)

deck: Boris Savic is a Boston-based comic book writer & artist and the founder of Rocket North Press, a regular fixture at SDCC and NYCC. He has created, written and illustrated the 3-book Banimon Series, as well as an ongoing online comic Tok-Tok's search available at http://www.banimon.com
name: Boris Savic

deck: British artist, most famous for creating some of the biggest characters in the Beano.
description:
Creator of these classic Beano strips:

  • Bash Street Kids (1953)
  • Little Plum (1953)
  • Minnie the Minx (1953)
  • The Three Bears (1959)

Baxendale also had a hand in the launch of two other British funny titles - The Beezer (1956) and Wham! (1964). In the 1970s he created Sweeny Toddler (for Shiver and Shake) and Willy the Kid (published by Gerald Duckworth).
name: Leo Baxendale

deck: Beatriz is the pseudonym of Santiago Segura.
description: Santiago Segura is a Spanish film actor, screenwriter, guionist, producer and director.
name: Beatriz (Santiago Segura)

deck: The writer of Rooster Teeth Productions comic.
description:
Started in 2006 the Rooster Teeth Comic was created by Griffon Ramsey in collaboration with artist Luke McKay.  
Griffon, the wife of the Red vs Blue co-creator, Geoff Ramsey, began writing about the antics around the Rooster Teeth office involving Geoff Ramsey and Gus Sorola. It was entitled Gus-Man.  
 
Since then the comic has been assembled into three TPB volumes.
 
Griffon lives in Austin, Texas with her husband and daughter. She is a set and costume designer and works on the Rooster Teeth shorts as well as the comics.
name: Griffon Ramsey

deck: Artist of both the Rooster Teeth Comics and Balls2That.
description:
Luke McKay started drawing Red vs Blue comics as a fan of the show. It wasn't until he was recognized by the Rooster Teeth staff that they asked him to work with them on a comic. In collaboration with writer Griffon Ramsey he began the Rooster Teeth Comic in 2006, exploring the antics that take place around the Rooster Teeth Productions office. So far there have been three TPB collections of the Rooster Teeth Comics, over three years of production. Luke often works his collaboration from Vancouver, Canada but has been fully inducted into the insanity of the Rooster Teeth office. 
 
Later McKay started another comic entitled Balls 2 That, circling around the perpetually injured Balls, his sidekick Mustard, and killer blender, Blendie. Balls2That is updated every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. It is an online comic written and drawn by Luke McKay. The first 100 comics have been collected into a TPB. It currently has a second book coming out. 
 
Previously Balls 2 That was a random mash up of funny four panel comics, but more recently Luke has been trying to push out a more cohesive story line, breaking away from the four panel nonsense of before.
name: Luke McKay

deck: American Actor who has recently turned to writing comics.
name: Kevin Shinick

deck: Artist. Often credited as Gabriel B. or Val. He is the older brother of Juan Bobillo.
name: Gabriel Bobillo

deck: Dean Trippe is a writer, artist, colorist and editor.
description: Dean writes and draws the webcomic Butterfly. He co-founded and co-edits Project: Rooftop.
name: Dean Trippe

deck: I'm currently editing the book in between my entertainment career obligations.
description:
There are two parts to the Black Mau story and a great number of characters involved that make the story possible. I will be introducing the characters to you in the coming weeks. 
 
I'm a writer primarily, but I'd like to work with a good comic illustrator. I'm willing to make the right illustrator an offer. This story is gold!
name: Taj Sonchai

deck: Japanese manga artist most known for the Strawberry Marshmallow Series.
name: Barasui

deck: Emiko Iwasaki is one of a very small number of female video game designers. She also illustrates and has done pieces for comics.
description:
Emiko joined Arc System Works in 1999. She started off as an Art Director on Guilty Gear Petitie and Guilty Gear Petitie 2, and also did illustrations for Guilty Gear XX and Guilty Gear Isuka.

She directed and planned Battle Fantasia, and also wrote the story and created the character designs with a 2D/3D artist. As if that wasn't enough, she also did the voice acting for Marco!  

She also does illustrates, and is known for doing video game covers and work for comics.

Work 

  • Guilty Gear Petit (2001) - Art Director
  • Guilty Gear Petit 2 (2001) - Art Director
  • Guilty Gear XX (2002) - Illustrator
  • Guilty Gear Isuka (2004) - Illustrator
  • Battle Fantasia (2007) - Director, voice of Marco Van de Land
name: Emiko Iwasaki

deck:
Creator and founder of Dark Elf Designs and XcapeCON.
Creator of the Comic book Character MoonShadow from Dark Elf Designs (Not to be Mistaken with the Vertigo comic character).
description:
Brian Germain is an artist and creator as well as the founder of Dark Elf Designs, an alliance of creative talent joined together for the purpose of promoting their talents through networking. They are a community of individuals grounded in the arts with a current focus on comics, graphic novels, and illustration. Since 1992 Brian has worked as a professional artist in addition to many of his other endeavors including but not limited to acting, filmography, event and talent promotion, and charity work. Brian has done work for the ACTOR comic fund (Now the Hero Initiative) as well as Whaley's Children's Center, Autism, The United Way, Protect.Org, MDA, and Animal Rescue.

Brian has worked for several companies, comics and projects over the years including Arrow Comics, Graham Stanley’s Invisible Art, Twisted Gate Entertainment, Affinity Press, Dynamo Comics, MAIN publishing, Sketch Card Studios, COM Publishing, Sword & Science, Adventurous Magazine, Champion City Comics, Infinity Comics Group and more.

Brian and his company Dark Elf Designs have been responsible for helping some great new up and coming talent get their start including J.S. Earls (creator of Pistolfist), Dwight MacPherson (Edgar Alan Poo, Jim Reaper, Dead Men Tell No Tales), Ozzy Longoria (Nathaniel Demon, Sails of Blood), Pierre Villeneuve (Flashback Universe, Saturn Knight) as well as networked with industry greats like Eddy Newell (Black Lightning), Bill Messner-Loebs (Journey’s, The MAXX), and Scott Rosema (Space Ghost, Silver Surfer).

Published work includes but is not limited to the following…

Great Dane Reporter (national ad) age 16

Comcast Cablevision (national ad) age 18

MoonShadow #0, 2003 Dark Elf Designs

The Shoe #1, 2004 Dark Elf Designs

The Gryphon #0, 2005 Dark Elf Designs

Captain Jolt #0 2005 Dark Elf Designs

The Sorrow #0, 2006 Dark Elf Designs

The Chosen Few #1, 2008 Dark Elf Designs (Inks w/ Peter Palmiotti)

Trixy Girl #1, 2007 Twisted Gate Entertainment (Colors)

War of The Worlds: Haven and the Hellweed #1, Arrow Comics 2007(cover)

War of The Worlds: Haven and the Hellweed #2, Arrow Comics 2008(cover)

War of The Worlds: Haven and the Hellweed #3, Arrow Comics 2008(cover)

Legerdemain: The Shattered Mage Saga, COM Publishing-Sword and Science 2007 (cover, Interior Illus. w/ Bill Loebs)

Chicken Wings For The Beer Drinker’s Soul, COM Publishing 2008 (cover)

Dreamers at Infinities Core, COM Publishing 2008 (cover)

A Not So Perfect Christmas, COM Publishing 2008 (cover, Interior Illus.)

A Puppy for Christmas, Horror Shorts 2011 (3 page comic)

Bounty Hunter #0 (Letters) 2013

Other Stuff

Wide Awake Club , Flint Journal Age 7

Lion’s Club logo Contest Age 12

Genesee County Art Fair First and Third Place winner age 14
name: Brian Germain
